-- | Disassociates the specified configuration document from the specified
--   instance.
--   
--   When you disassociate a configuration document from an instance, it
--   does not change the configuration of the instance. To change the
--   configuration state of an instance after you disassociate a
--   configuration document, you must create a new configuration document
--   with the desired configuration and associate it with the instance.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ssm/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteAssociation.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SSM.DeleteAssociation
data DeleteAssociation

-- | <a>DeleteAssociation</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:

--   <li><a>da1Name</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
deleteAssociation :: Text -> Text -> DeleteAssociation

-- | The ID of the instance.
da1InstanceId :: Lens' DeleteAssociation Text

-- | The name of the configuration document.
da1Name :: Lens' DeleteAssociation Text

-- | Creates a configuration document.
--   
--   After you create a configuration document, you can use
--   <tt>CreateAssociation</tt> to associate it with one or more running
--   instances.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ssm/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDocument.html</a>

--   </ul>
createDocument :: Text -> Text -> CreateDocument

--   file, see <a>Configuration Document</a>.

-- | Associates the specified configuration documents with the specified
--   instances.
--   
--   When you associate a configuration document with an instance, the
--   configuration agent on the instance processes the configuration
--   document and configures the instance as specified.
--   
--   If you associate a configuration document with an instance that
--   already has an associated configuration document, we replace the
--   current configuration document with the new configuration document.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ssm/latest/APIReference/API_CreateAssociationBatch.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SSM.CreateAssociationBatch
data CreateAssociationBatch

-- | <a>CreateAssociationBatch</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cabEntries</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>CreateAssociationBatchRequestEntry</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
createAssociationBatch :: CreateAssociationBatch

-- | One or more associations.
cabEntries :: Lens' CreateAssociationBatch [CreateAssociationBatchRequestEntry]
data CreateAssociationBatchResponse

-- | <a>CreateAssociationBatchResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>cabrFailed</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>FailedCreateAssociation</a>]</li>
--   <li><a>cabrSuccessful</a> <tt>::</tt>
--   [<a>AssociationDescription</a>]</li>
--   </ul>
createAssociationBatchResponse :: CreateAssociationBatchResponse

-- | Information about the associations that failed.
cabrFailed :: Lens' CreateAssociationBatchResponse [FailedCreateAssociation]

-- | Information about the associations that succeeded.
cabrSuccessful :: Lens' CreateAssociationBatchResponse [AssociationDescription]
instance Eq CreateAssociationBatch
instance Read CreateAssociationBatch
instance Show CreateAssociationBatch
instance Monoid CreateAssociationBatch
instance Semigroup CreateAssociationBatch
instance Eq CreateAssociationBatchResponse
instance Read CreateAssociationBatchResponse
instance Show CreateAssociationBatchResponse
instance FromJSON CreateAssociationBatchResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateAssociationBatch
instance ToJSON CreateAssociationBatch
instance ToHeaders CreateAssociationBatch
instance ToQuery CreateAssociationBatch
instance ToPath CreateAssociationBatch
instance IsList CreateAssociationBatch


-- | Associates the specified configuration document with the specified
--   instance.
--   
--   When you associate a configuration document with an instance, the
--   configuration agent on the instance processes the configuration
--   document and configures the instance as specified.
--   
--   If you associate a configuration document with an instance that
--   already has an associated configuration document, we replace the
--   current configuration document with the new configuration document.
--   
--   
--   <a>http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ssm/latest/APIReference/API_CreateAssociation.html</a>
module Network.AWS.SSM.CreateAssociation
data CreateAssociation

-- | <a>CreateAssociation</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>caInstanceId</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   <li><a>caName</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Text</a></li>
--   </ul>
createAssociation :: Text -> Text -> CreateAssociation

-- | The ID of the instance.
caInstanceId :: Lens' CreateAssociation Text

-- | The name of the configuration document.
caName :: Lens' CreateAssociation Text
data CreateAssociationResponse

-- | <a>CreateAssociationResponse</a> constructor.
--   
--   The fields accessible through corresponding lenses are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>carAssociationDescription</a> <tt>::</tt> <a>Maybe</a>
--   <a>AssociationDescription</a></li>
--   </ul>
createAssociationResponse :: CreateAssociationResponse

-- | Information about the association.
carAssociationDescription :: Lens' CreateAssociationResponse (Maybe AssociationDescription)
instance Eq CreateAssociation
instance Ord CreateAssociation
instance Read CreateAssociation
instance Show CreateAssociation
instance Eq CreateAssociationResponse
instance Read CreateAssociationResponse
instance Show CreateAssociationResponse
instance FromJSON CreateAssociationResponse
instance AWSRequest CreateAssociation
instance ToJSON CreateAssociation
instance ToHeaders CreateAssociation
instance ToQuery CreateAssociation
instance ToPath CreateAssociation


-- | Amazon EC2 Simple Systems Manager (SSM) enables you to configure and
--   manage your EC2 instances. You can create a configuration document and
--   then associate it with one or more running instances.
module Network.AWS.SSM
